Description: Very fine scarab, made of glazed steatite, completely preserved. Fine details carved, whitish-beige colour with incised lines, remains of beige glaze preserved on the back. The division between head and prothorax is shown with a single line. The division between prothorax and elytra is shown with notches at the sides as well as a double line, one line running on each side of the notches. The suture is shown in a double line as well, the humeral callosities are not shown. The shape of the head is oval, no eyes indicated. The clypeus shows three grooves, dividing it into four lobes. The plates at the sides are shown as well. The side of the scarab shows three deep and finely carved legs on each side that show details of hairs in small grooves on all legs. The legs are slightly protruding over the body when seen from above. Seen from the side, the legs are sitting on a base plate. The seal at the base shows an oval line framing the base, inside several hieroglyphs. From top to bottom: a horizontal line above a Htp, underneath left an n above a wedjat-eye facing to the right, right of it the red crown, underneath both a horizontal line. The orientation of the seal is longitudinal, as is the perforation of the object.
